alert.note: Alert for Rensselaer; Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 3:18PM EST until February 05 at 1:20AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Hoosic River At Eagle Bridge. * WHEN...From this afternoon to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11 feet, Flood stage. Water on County Route 103 between Route 67 and the covered bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 PM EST Friday was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...Flooding is due to an ice jam. The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 4.1 feet early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 11 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.7 feet on 03/22/1980. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Hoosic River Eagle Bridge Flood Stage: 11.0 Observed Stage at Fri 2 pm: 11.7 Forecast: Fri 7 pm 11.1 Sat 1 am 9.3 Sat 7 am 9.1 Sat 1 pm 4.9 Sat 7 pm 4.7 Sun 1 am 4.6 Sun 7 am 4.5 Sun 1 pm 4.4 Sun 7 pm 4.3 Mon 1 am 4.2 Mon 7 am 4.1 &&
